pr_title: Mark tasks as DROPPED if assigned participant does not exist

timeline.message:
Mark task to DROPPED for the workflows being stopped

In this commit, if the workflow or job is being stopped, but
the assigned participant becomes offline for the task, the
ttask would be marked as DROPPED which allow the workflow
and job to go to STOPPED state.

timeline.bodyText: This looks like an override of processing result... Can we have the logic in somewhere in scheduling task? This is more like a patching after scheduling computation. It waste the scheduling computation if instance is not live.
timeline.author: junkaixue

replies.bodyText: We have this logic in the handleAdditionalTasks in filterTask method. Since that part of the code only hits when TargetState is equal to start, I moved the logic here so in all conditions we evaluate it. If the instance is not live, we still need to schedule the task if the task needs to be scheduled on other instances. If the instance is not live, then we do not see the task in current states which means we would no process the task in this case.
replies.author: alirezazamani

replies.bodyText: I understand the complexity of doing the check. So my question is when could this happening? We need to think about to put to the right place. Add here works, but it looks like a "saving action" without understand any assignment logic. I would prefer to understand the scenario and move the check logic for assignment there.
replies.author: junkaixue

replies.bodyText: It happens when workflow/job is being stopped (in STOPPING state) and the message is being sent and not processed yet (or the controller has not seen the effect yet) then the live instance is gone. In this case, the job will be stuck in the STOPPING state and the controller does not have a way to mark the task and job to be STOPPED. Note that all new assignment is happening when TargetState is START in handleAdditionTaskAssigment. If not, then assignment logic does not exist and will not be considered. We need to somehow manage this case before that. Note that when the live instance is gone, the controller does not see anything on the instance. I cannot find a better way to achieve this. If you know how it can be resolved, please let me know and I can change it accordingly. Also if you look at handleAdditionalTaskAssignment.filterTask method, it is the same code. I basically changed the place of this code and move it earlier in the pipeline.
